intro: Saffordiella, commonly known as the desert bell, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, with deep taproots that help it access water from underground sources. Saffordiella produces small, edible pods that contain seeds, and it plays a role in stabilizing desert soils. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
